poem:
Title: Amidst Steel Colds

In Russia's hawkish gaze,
wars, embossed on icy breath,
Norway's boon in billion kroner
kindles hope - a temper,
against winter's approach so cruel.

Ukrainian toil, under starless nights,
sparks in exclusive defiance—
a mosaic of Recovery.
Petty tyrant, mark your own jest,
as energy, like resilience,
does not wither in siege,
but debuts each dawn anew.
